segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of the message and to transmit function, type and number of the message.
DII, A segment specifying the identity of the directory set and giving its language and maintenance operation.
DTM, A segment specifying dates related to the directory set, such as date of approval, date of submission or WP.4 acceptance date.
FTX, A segment providing free text information related to the directory set.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the transaction with associated information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the parties involved in the transaction, e.g. originator, requestor or secretariat.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying a person or a department and identifying communication type(s) and number(s).

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the leading NAD segment to whom the communication should be directed.
COM, A segment identifying communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or department(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments providing a message type directory.

segment.documentation: MSG, A segment identifying a message type to be specified.

ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to a message type. It may indicate whether the message is a batch or an interactive message, or may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the message in the current release of the message type directory.
FTX, A segment providing textual information related to the message type, namely: message type name, Introduction, Scope, Functional definition, Principles, References and Terms and definitions.
DTM, This segment is used to indicate the release date of a message, as indicated on the cover page of the boilerplate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments specifying a message type structure and its related functional definition.

segment.documentation: SGU, A segment specifying the usage of a segment in a message type structure.

ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to the usage of a segment in a message type structure. It may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the segment within the message structure in the current release of the message type directory.
FTX, A segment providing textual information about segment usage. This information comprises part of the 'Data segment clarification' section.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying a segment group and providing details about segment group usage.

segment.documentation: GRU, A segment specifying the usage of a segment group in a message type structure.

ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to the usage of a segment group in a message type structure. It may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the segment group within the message structure in the current release of the message type directory.
FTX, A segment providing the textual information about segment group usage. This information comprises part of the 'Data Segment Clarification' section.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments used to specify dependency notes or other notes about the usage of segments and/or segment groups in a message type structure.

segment.documentation: FNT, A segment to provide the footnote identification for a dependency note or other note that is applicable to one or more segments and/or segment groups in the message type structure.
REL, A segment to provide the type of dependency relationship, where one exists.
GIR, A segment to provide the position number(s) for segments and/or segment groups to which a dependency note or other note applies.
ATT, A segment to provide the change indicators at the note level.
FTX, A segment to provide a free text description of the dependency note or other note.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments providing a segment directory.

segment.documentation: SEG, A segment identifying a segment type and specifying its class and maintenance operation.

ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to a segment type. It may indicate whether the segment is a batch or an interactive segment, or may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the segment in the current release of the segment directory.
FTX, A segment specifying the name and functional definition of a segment type.
ELU, A segment specifying the contents of data elements in a segment type.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments used to specify dependency notes or other notes about the usage of data elements in a segment type.

segment.documentation: FNT, A segment to provide the footnote identification for a dependency note or other note that is applicable to one or more data elements in a segment type.
REL, A segment to provide the type of dependency relationship, where one exists.
GIR, A segment to provide the position number(s) for a data element to which a dependency note or other note applies.
ATT, A segment to provide the change indicators at the note level.
FTX, A segment to provide a free text description of the dependency note or other note.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments providing a composite data element directory.

segment.documentation: CMP, A segment identifying a composite data element and specifying its class and maintenance operation.

ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to a composite data element type. It may indicate whether the composite data element is a batch or an interactive composite data element, or may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the composite data element in the current release of the composite data element directory.
FTX, A segment specifying the name and functional definition of a composite data element type.
ELU, A segment specifying component data elements in a composite data element and its related information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments used to specify dependency notes or other notes about the usage of component data elements in a composite data element type.

segment.documentation: FNT, A segment to provide the footnote identification for a dependency note or other note that is applicable to one or more component data elements in a composite data element type.
REL, A segment to provide the type of dependency relationship, where one exists.
GIR, A segment to provide the position number(s) for a data element to which a dependency note or other note applies.
ATT, A segment to provide the change indicators at the note level.
FTX, A segment to provide a free text description of the dependency note or other note.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments providing a data element directory.

segment.documentation: ELM, A segment identifying a simple data element and giving related information.

ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to a simple data element type. It may indicate whether the data element is a batch, or an interactive, or both a batch and an interactive simple data element. It may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the data element in the current release of the simple data element directory.
FTX, A segment specifying the name and functional definition of a simple data element.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments providing a code list directory.

segment.documentation: CDS, A segment specifying a code set. In DIRDEF data element 9434 shall not be used.
FTX, A segment providing textual information related to the code list.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments specifying a code value and its functional definition.

segment.documentation: CDV, A segment specifying a code value.
ATT, A segment used to specify an attribute related to a code value. It may indicate the specific type of maintenance applied to the code value in the current release of the code list directory.
FTX, A segment specifying the name and functional definition of a code value.
